intro: Cypella brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed cypella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
